q: Which HTML tag defines the main heading of a page?
e: The <h1> tag represents the primary heading of a document.

q: Which attribute provides alternative text for an image?
e: The alt attribute supplies text shown when an image cannot load.

q: Which HTML element creates a hyperlink?
e: The <a> element anchors a link to another resource.

q: Which element groups block-level content semantically?
e: <section> denotes a standalone thematic grouping of content.

q: Which tag is best suited for marking navigation links?
e: The <nav> element defines a section of navigation links.

q: Which meta tag sets the character encoding to UTF-8?
e: The charset attribute specifies the document character encoding.

q: Which element introduces a line break without creating a new paragraph?
e: inserts a line break within text flow.

q: Which attribute ensures form inputs are associated with a label?
e: The for attribute on a <label> should match the id of the input.

q: Which element provides the document's main landmark for screen readers?
e: The <main> element identifies primary page content.

q: Which tag should wrap a blog post title to emphasize document structure?
e: <h2> is typically used for titles directly under the page heading.

q: Which attribute is required on the element for valid HTML?
e: The alt attribute is required to provide alternative text.
